pageContext.claim: “Did you see they found 50,000 ballots in like a river?”
pageContext.analysis: It is unclear what Trump is talking about. As far as we can tell, no ballots were found dumped in a river in North Carolina. Possibly he is referring to 11,000 inaccurate pre-filled voter registration applications — not ballots —that were sent to North Carolinians from Civitech, a technology vendor that works with companies and campaigns to increase voter registrations, the North Carolina State Board of Elections said in an Oct. 6 press release. Civitech apologized and promised to send out “corrected mailers with blank applications to all affected NC recipients.” Alternatively, a more specific case occurred in 2018, when 1,000 completed ballots in North Carolina were allegedly destroyed — but that was part of an apparent electoral fraud effort conducted on behalf of a Republican congressional candidate.
